title: Cope, 17th century
medium:
Medium: Tussah silk embroidery, cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in chain and back stitch with French knots on two layers of plain weave; inner layer of unspun cotton
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Elizabeth Haynes
description: Semi-circular cope with a central square flanked by two wedge shapes and framed by a number of borders, all filled with a variety of fantastic and naturalistic birds, animals, and hunters on horses or elephants. In golden tan Tussah silk in fine chain stitch with outline and knot stitch fillings and accents on cotton ground now mellowed to a light brown color and covered closely with fine scrolling leaf pattern in same silk in outline stitch. Similar cotton backing caught in with some of the quilting and major embroidery parts.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cope, 17th century. Medium: Tussah silk embroidery, cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in chain and back stitch with French knots on two layers of plain weave; inner layer of unspun cotton. Museum purchase through gift of Elizabeth Haynes. 1951-41-1.
